In my case, I'm using the index (points to an offset in the file that contains the start
of a parseable chunk of xml).  I ran my program for about an hour before hitting that
error.

As I mentioned in the list, this is go1.1.1 and it crashed here:

                if repeat > 0 { 
                        // We have decoded a complete run-length so we need to 
                        // replicate the last output symbol. 
                        for i := 0; i < repeat; i++ { 
                                b := byte(mtf.First()) 
                                bz2.tt[bufIndex] = uint32(b)    //  here be panic 
                                bz2.c[b]++ 
                                bufIndex++ 
                        } 
                        repeat = 0 
                } 

In my particular crashing program, I was reading from a buffered reader from an http
response body.  I parsed about 8.4 million records in the ~58 minutes this was running
(i.e. it seemed to work well for a while, but will be a little painful to reproduce).
